DataElement.preferredName: Patient Oral Dryness Assessment Visual Analog Scale Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent a patient's self-identified oral dryness intensity on a 10 point Visual Analog Scale (VAS), in which '0' is no dryness and '10' is the worst dryness.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._The cavity located at the upper end of the alimentary canal, behind the teeth and gums that is bounded on the outside by the lips, above by the hard and soft palates and below by the tongue._Dryness; lacking moisture, or the feeling thereof._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: The cavity lying at the upper end of the alimentary canal, bounded on the outside by the lips and inside by the oropharynx and containing in humans the tongue, gums, and teeth.:Dryness; lacking moisture, or the feeling thereof.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The cavity located at the upper end of the alimentary canal, behind the teeth and gums that is bounded on the outside by the lips, above by the hard and soft palates and below by the tongue.
The lack of natural or normal moisture.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient._A pain scale marked off like a ruler from 0 to 10 on which the patient marks the current level of pain experienced._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.:A pain scale marked off like a ruler from 0 to 10 on which the patient marks the current level of pain experienced.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

A pain scale marked off like a ruler from 0 to 10 on which the patient marks the current level of pain experienced.

ReferenceDocuments.name: On a 0 to 10 scale, how DRY i
ReferenceDocuments.description: On a 0 to 10 scale, how DRY is your mouth NOW? Please circle the number.
